meanings.definition: A stone set at the foot of a grave marker.
meanings.sent1: The footstones marked the end of the grave.
meanings.sent2: The cemetery was filled with footstones at the base of each tombstone.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel hid acorns under the footstones, thinking they were treasure chests.
meanings.sent4: The footstones stood like loyal guardians at the feet of the tombstones.
meanings.sent5: The footstones, weathered by time, held stories of those resting above.

meanings.sent1: She carefully arranged the footstones in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed various footstones from different time periods.
meanings.sent3: The children played a game, pretending the footstones were stepping stones in a river.
meanings.sent4: The footstones in the field resembled a scattered puzzle waiting to be solved.
meanings.sent5: The footstones, though small, carried the weight of history within their simple shapes.
